meanings.definition: A shape produced by a curve that bends around and crosses itself.
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster had a big loop that made everyone scream with excitement.
meanings.sent2: She tied a loop in the ribbon to make a pretty bow on the gift.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail in a loop, thinking it had found a new friend.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were stuck in a loop, replaying the same memories over and over.
meanings.sent5: The loop of the necklace sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A length of thread, rope, or similar material, doubled or crossing itself, typically used for fastening or binding.
meanings.sent1: She made a loop with the rope to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used a loop of thread to stitch the button back onto the shirt.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending loop of scarves out of his hat, amazing the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace was a loop of pearls, symbolizing eternity and grace.
meanings.sent5: The loop of yarn slipped off the needle, causing her to start knitting again.

meanings.definition: A structure, series, or process that is repeated or can be repeated.
meanings.sent1: The computer program had a loop that repeated the same task until it was done.
meanings.sent2: The dance routine had a fun loop that the dancers performed in perfect synchronization.
meanings.sent3: The joke he told was so funny that it got stuck in a loop, making everyone laugh again and again.
meanings.sent4: Her daily routine felt like a loop, starting with breakfast and ending with bedtime.
meanings.sent5: The song had a catchy loop that kept playing in her head all day long.
